column4: Hi.. is there a script out there for saving installed software/ppa:s I could use before fresh install?
there should be a way to export a list of packages to a file through synaptic, though, I'm not sure if sources.list records PPAs (someone else?)
chu: yes there is.. I am asking since I havent seen a script like that and took a chance to ask first

if you don't mind using a terminal, you could write a simple bash script which does something like "dpkg --get-selections | grep -v deinstall > $package-list" and saves your sources.list (assuming PPAs are recorded), then write a script to restore them after re-install.
chu: I am looking over that option atm.. thanks for the confirm - seems I am on the right path
if all goes well I ll release it at gnome-look
I'm guessing "dpkg --set-selections > $package-list" would then restore the packages. But I don't know how you can save your PPAs.
